name: places/ChIJQTBZybJZwokRLTHPDFu1MWI

displayName.text: Pura Dermatology Hudson Yards: Best Dermatologist NYC, Botox, Juvederm, Dysport, Acne Treatment, Scar Removal

formattedAddress: 446 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 446 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text:
After seeing 3 dermatologists, 1 virologist, 1 immunologist and even doing a biopsy to find out why my hands and feet were peeling, Dr Lodha figured it out as soon as he saw me. He gave me the right treatment and the issue is now gone after 2 years searching for the cure.
I also got my botox with him, and waited 6 months to leave this review because I like to recommend what is good after being really sure of it.
So yes!1000 stars ⭐️  to Dr Lodha and his team.
I also used the sunscreen he recommended and I loved it!

originalText.text: Thanks to Nicoline Tegnell, the inflammation around my eyes that had been bothering me for four and a half months since the end of July was completely healed within a month. She gave me hope during the first appointment by telling me it would heal. I was very encouraged by her smile and cheerfulness. She listens to us fully, her diagnosis is concise, and the appointments are quick. She responded promptly and politely to my email inquiries. I would recommend anyone with skin problems to try her.

text.text: Thanks to Nicoline Tegnell, the inflammation around my eyes that had been bothering me for four and a half months since the end of July was completely healed within a month. She listens to us fully, her diagnosis is concise, and the appointments are quick. She responded promptly and politely to my email inquiries. I would recommend anyone with skin problems to try her.

originalText.text: I’m very impressed with this office. Nicoline addressed an issue I’ve had for several years of AK on my lip. She’s very professional personable and kind, and all my interactions with office staff were positive. Will return!

text.text: I’m very impressed with this office. Nicoline addressed an issue I’ve had for several years of AK on my lip. She’s very professional personable and kind, and all my interactions with office staff were positive. Will return!

originalText.text:
Dr Lodha did not take the time to understand my history and its impact on my situation. He looked at me for 5 seconds before coming to a (incorrect) diagnosis, which was incredibly disappointing given I have a history of nonclassical presentation of this particular issue. He did not care even though I mentioned this. He also prescribed me a topical medicine which I've already been taking without asking if I've ever taken it. I was so dejected that I didn’t even bother to argue given he seemed unwilling to understand any nuance and more concerned with conducting appointments quickly.  I was so disappointed in this experience. Luckily an opening came up at Weill Cornell today so I had the opportunity to see a dermatologist better versed in taking medical conditions into account who came to different and more appropriate conclusions than Dr Lodha. The timing was impeccable and it was a night and day experience. I would not come here if you have any medical dermatology issues. Seems better suited for surface and cosmetic counsel.

EDIT to address comment below: Dr Lodha passive aggressively suggested I could get a second opinion if I wanted as he rushed out of the room at the end. Seemed very offended that I questioned his diagnosis though I was merely sharing facts from my medical history. All of it, as I said, off putting. Frankly, it’s incredibly inappropriate to mention you were in the room. If you were in fact the tech in the room, I’m 100% positive all should be kept confidential. So, shame on you.

originalText.text: My teen daughter was treated with such patience and kindness. With outstanding bed side manners and understanding. Did not feel rushed with all questions been answered. My daughter said “ the best doctor” … what else can I add ))
